results.title: Basic shots
results.brief_description: Defines and illustrates the range of film shots from very long to very close as used in television production. Discusses basic composition rules for one person, several, groups and crowds. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic parts and threading of the sewing machine
results.brief_description: Illustrates the construction and operation of a Singer 404 sewing machine. Demonstrates the filling of the bobbin and threading of the machine. Close up photography is used to show the position and use of the various parts. No other credits available.

results.title: The Basic elements of production
results.brief_description: Compares the simple production of hand-made pottery with modern mass production methods, showing the basic similarities in the two processes. Emphasizes the interdependence of natural resources, labour, capital, and management in both processes. Explains the role of the consumer in the production of goods and services and in regulating their supply. No credits available.

results.title: Base line measurements
results.brief_description: Illustrates the principles which lie behind the design and manufacture of survey equipment. This film explains in detail the method measuring a “Base Line” as a first stage in land survey by triangulation method. Emphasises the corrections which have to be made when using base line equipment to allow for errors due to gravity, direction and height above sea level. No other credits available.

results.title: Bartleby
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Herman Melville’s story about Bartleby, the scrivener, who answers an advertisement for work with a lawyer and after a brief spurt of intense work, gradually breaks down, refuses to move and eventually dies because he has lost the will to live. A detailed discussion and analysis of the story follows. Features a cameo appearance of the actor who played Greg Brady in the popular television series ‘The Brady Bunch’ as a law clerk.

results.title: Bars of silver
results.creator_credit: Editorial Film Productions and Unilever Films
results.brief_description: Every day at fishing ports along the coast of Britain, fishermen land their catch. Twenty-four hours later the fish is available for sale in shops all over the country. This film illustrates all aspects of this industry - the trawlers and drifters; busy quaysides and fish auctions, the freezing, filleting, washing and boxing; trains criss-crossing through the night; centuries old Billingsgate fish market.

results.title: Barriers
results.brief_description: A group of young people discuss the problems a particular person has in relating in American Society. Unrehearsed, the film talks about such topics as racial conflicts, suspicion, gangs and the social/economic classes. No other credits available.

results.title: Barrier story
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the city and people of Broken Hill, situated on one of the richest silver, lead and zinc fields in the world. Emphasis is laid on the rapid development of Broken Hill into a modern mining community with all the facilities for pleasant living and recreation. There is wealth and security, social progress and industrial peace in the ‘Barrier City’.
